I am a beacon of integrity, acting with honesty and integrity.
I am a champion of kindness, showing compassion and generosity to my partner and others.
I am a master of patience, understanding that good things take time and effort to flourish.
I am a guardian of boundaries, respecting my own needs and boundaries while honoring those of my partner.
I am a pillar of support, offering encouragement and guidance to my partner in times of need.
I am a warrior of forgiveness, letting go of past grievances and embracing a future filled with love and understanding.
I am a champion of compromise, finding common ground and solutions that benefit both me and my partner.
I am a master of empathy, understanding and sharing in my partner's joys and sorrows.
I am a pillar of understanding, listening with an open heart and mind to my partner's thoughts and feelings.
I am a warrior of romance, keeping the spark alive with gestures of love and affection.
I am a champion of commitment, dedicated to building a strong and lasting bond with my partner.
I am a master of self-love, recognizing my own worth and embracing my strengths and weaknesses.
I am a guardian of honesty, speaking my truth with courage and integrity in all my relationships.
I am a pillar of stability, providing a safe and secure foundation for my partner to lean on.
I am a warrior of patience, trusting in the timing of destiny to bring the perfect partner into my life.
I am a champion of discernment, recognizing the worth of waiting for a love that matches my soul's desires.
I am a master of self-respect, refusing to settle for anything less than the deep connection I deserve.
I am a guardian of boundaries, safeguarding my heart until it finds its rightful counterpart.
I am nurturing my own happiness until it intertwines with another's in perfect harmony.
I believe in the God's plan to deliver the ideal partner into my life when the time is right.
I am a champion of patience, knowing that true love is worth the wait and the journey it takes to find it.
I bounce back from temporary disappointments in pursuit of lasting fulfillment.
I believe that the right person is out there, searching for me as I am for them.
I am a pillar of wisdom, understanding that rushing into love only leads to heartache, while waiting ensures a bond built on solid ground.
I recognize my own value and refusing to settle for anything less than extraordinary love.
I am a champion of authenticity, embracing my true self and waiting for a love that accepts me completely.
I am a master of perseverance, enduring the trials of solitude until my match arrives.
I am full of optimism, maintaining a hopeful heart and an open mind as I await the arrival of my soulmate.
I trust in the God's divine timing to orchestrate a love story beyond my wildest dreams.
I use my time of waiting to grow, evolve, and become the person my future partner deserves.
I know that my worth is not defined by my relationship status and that waiting for the right person is a testament to my strength.
I am a champion of intuition, listening to the whispers of my heart and patiently waiting for love's perfect melody to join in harmony.
I am a master of self-reflection, using this period of waiting to delve deep into my desires, values, and aspirations for a future partnership.
I nurture my mind, body, and soul so that I am ready to give and receive love when the right person comes along.
I am a pillar of independence, thriving in my own company and finding joy in the journey of self-discovery as I wait for love's perfect timing.
The right person will come into my life at the perfect time.
I bravely step away from relationships that no longer serves my highest good.
I break free from the chains of a relationship that stifles my spirit.
I honoring my needs and boundaries by leaving a relationship that doesn't honor them.
I choose to walk away from a relationship that doesn't align with my true self.
I face the unknown with strength and conviction as I leave behind what no longer serves me.
I prioritize my happiness and well-being by exiting a relationship that drains my energy.
I reclaiming my autonomy by ending a relationship that disempowers me.
I embrace the opportunity for personal evolution that comes with letting go of a stagnant relationship.
I bounce back from the end of a relationship with grace and resilience.
I protect my heart from further harm by leaving a relationship that causes pain.
I embrace the freedom that comes with releasing myself from a relationship that holds me back.
I am a master of self-renewal, embracing the opportunity for personal reinvention that comes with the closure of this relationship.
I take control of my destiny by ending a relationship that no longer aligns with my vision.
I am a champion of self-discovery, embracing the journey of self-exploration that awaits me after leaving this relationship.
I free myself from the chains of a toxic relationship and reclaim my autonomy and happiness.
I don't worry about anything, because I pray about everything.
I will always be with you, don't be afraid.
I will strengthen you and help you.
Keep alert at all times.
Don't worry about tomorrow, tomorrow will bring it's own worries.
I am leaving you with a gift-peace of mind and heart.
The peace I give is a gift the world can't give you.
Give attention to my words, keep them in your heart, they are life and health to all your flesh.
I will give you a long life.
I forgave all your sins.
Don't be sin conscious, I remember them nomore.
I will never fail you or leave you.
I get stronger everyday.
My promises can never fail.
Give your burdens to the Lord, and he will take care of you.
declarations.affirmationText: I give all my problems to God and He takes care of them.

declarations.text: A thousand may fall at my side, and ten thousand at my right hand, but it will not come near me.
My youth is renewed like the eagles.
My promises don't come back empty.
He sent out his word and healed them, snatching them from the door of death.
I will not die, I will live to tell what God has done.
The Lord himself watches over me.
I will remain in joy and patiently wait for my health to return.
I will keep my mind on Jesus the one who I can trust 100%.
He gives power to the weak and strength to the powerless.
Those who trust in the Lord will find new strength.
Don't be afraid. I am here to help you.
My healing will spring forth speedily.
I am healed and made whole by Jesus stripes.
I am blessed because I trust and hope in the Lord.
I prosper even in times of drought.
My abundance can't be stopped.
Nothing is to hard for God, I know I am healed.
I will restore to you the years that the swarming locust has eaten.
I am the healer of all diseases. Be cleansed.
I already carried all of your sins and diseases. It is finished.
If you believe I can heal you, it will be done.
I have great compassion for you.
Believe you receive what you're asking for and you will have them.
You are loosed from your infirmity.
Come boldly to me, I will help you in your time of need.
I will not in any way fail you.
God will never give up on me or leave me.
Jesus is my healer.
I will have a good long life.
Since he did not spare even his own Son, but gave him up for us all, won't he also freely give us everything else?
It is good to give thanks to the Lord, to sing praises to the Most High.
It is good to proclaim your unfailing love in the morning, your faithfulness in the evening.
You thrill me, Lord with all you have done for me!
But you, O Lord, will be exalted forever.
You have made me as strong as an wild ox.
The godly will flourish like palm trees.
Even in old age I will produce fruit, I will remain vital and green.
The Lord is my rock!
The Lord is my rock!
There is no evil in him!
The Lord is king! He is robed in majesty!
Your reign, Lord, is holy forever and ever.
Joyful are those you discipline, Lord, you teach me with instructions.
When doubt fills my mind, your comfort gives me hope and joy.
The Lord is my fortress, my God is my mighty rock.
Come, let us worship and bow down. Let us kneel before the Lord our maker
I will shout joyfully and praise the Rock of my salvation.
I will tell everyone of the amazing things God does.
Great is the Lord! He is most worthy of praise!
He is to be feared above all gods.
The Lord reigns!
The Lord is king!
The Lord is supreme over all the earth.
I will rejoice in the Lord and praise his holy name!
The Lord is good. His unfailing love continues forever.
I will lead a life of integrity.
I refuse to look at anything vile and vulgar.
I reject perverse ideas and stay away from all evil.
I search for faithful people to be my companions.
Liars will not stay in my presence.
Let all that I am praise the Lord.
I will praise God to my last breathe!
Let all my thoughts be pleasing to him.
I will continually seek the Lord.
Until the time came to fulfill his dreams, the Lord tested Joseph's character.
I am attractive.
I am limitless because God is in me.
He sent out his word and healed them, snatching them from the door of death.
Blessed is the one who does not walk in step with the wicked or stand in the way that sinners take or sit in the company of mockers.
But whose delight is in the law of the Lord, and who meditates on his law day and night.
That person is like a tree planted by streams of water, which yields its fruit in season and whose leaf does not wither—whatever they do prospers.
The Lord watches over the way of the righteous, but the way of the wicked leads to destruction.
I will tell of the decree: The Lord said to me, 'You are my Son; today I have become your father.  - Jesus
Serve the Lord with fear and celebrate his rule with trembling.
Blessed are all who take refuge in him.
The Lord is my shepherd, I lack nothing.
He makes me lie down in green pastures, he leads me beside quiet waters.
He refreshes my soul. He guides me along the right paths for his name’s sake.
Even though I walk through the darkest valley, I will fear no evil, for you are with me; your rod and your staff, they comfort me.
You prepare a table before me in the presence of my enemies. You anoint my head with oil; my cup overflows.
Surely goodness and mercy shall follow me all the days of my life, and I will dwell in the house of the Lord forever.
Answer me when I call to you, my righteous God. Give me relief from my distress; have mercy on me and hear my prayer.
Know that the Lord has set apart his faithful servant for himself; the Lord hears when I call to him.
In peace I will lie down and sleep, for you alone, Lord, make me dwell in safety.
Lead me, Lord, in your righteousness because of my enemies—make your way straight before me.
But let all who take refuge in you be glad; let them ever sing for joy. Spread your protection over them, that those who love your name may rejoice in you.
For the Lord watches over the way of the righteous, but the way of the wicked leads to ruin.
I will give thanks to the Lord because of his righteousness; I will sing the praises of the name of the Lord Most High.
The Lord is a refuge for the oppressed, a stronghold in times of trouble.
Those who know your name trust in you, for you, Lord, have never forsaken those who seek you.
Sing the praises of the Lord, enthroned in Zion; proclaim among the nations what he has done.
The Lord is known by his acts of justice; the wicked are ensnared by the work of their hands.
The Lord is my light and my salvation—whom shall I fear? The Lord is the stronghold of my life—of whom shall I be afraid?
One thing I ask from the Lord, this only do I seek: that I may dwell in the house of the Lord all the days of my life, to gaze on the beauty of the Lord and to seek him in his temple.
Hear my voice when I call, Lord; be merciful to me and answer me.
Teach me your way, Lord; lead me in a straight path because of my oppressors.
I remain confident of this: I will see the goodness of the Lord in the land of the living.
Wait for the Lord; be strong and take heart and wait for the Lord.
To you, Lord, I call; you are my Rock, do not turn a deaf ear to me.
The Lord is my strength and my shield; my heart trusts in him, and he helps me.
The Lord is the strength of his people, a fortress of salvation for his anointed one.
Ascribe to the Lord, you heavenly beings, ascribe to the Lord glory and strength.
The voice of the Lord is powerful; the voice of the Lord is majestic.
The Lord gives strength to his people; the Lord blesses his people with peace.
I will exalt you, Lord, for you have lifted me out of the depths.
You turned my wailing into dancing; you removed my sackcloth and clothed me with joy.
Sing the praises of the Lord, you his faithful people; praise his holy name.
In you, Lord, I have taken refuge; let me never be put to shame; deliver me in your righteousness.
Be strong and take heart, all you who hope in the Lord.
Blessed is the one whose transgressions are forgiven, whose sins are covered.
Rejoice in the Lord and be glad, you righteous; sing, all you who are upright in heart!
The earth is full of the steadfast love of the Lord.
Taste and see that the Lord is good; blessed is the one who takes refuge in him.
The Lord is close to the brokenhearted and saves those who are crushed in spirit.
My soul will boast in the Lord; let the afflicted hear and rejoice.
The righteous cry out, and the Lord hears them; he delivers them from all their troubles.
Delight yourself in the Lord, and he will give you the desires of your heart.
The salvation of the righteous comes from the Lord; he is their stronghold in time of trouble.
Commit your way to the Lord; trust in him and he will do this.
Be still before the Lord and wait patiently for him; do not fret when people succeed in their ways.
For the Lord loves the just and will not forsake his faithful ones.
The mouth of the righteous utters wisdom, and their tongues speak what is just.
I waited patiently for the Lord; he turned to me and heard my cry.
He put a new song in my mouth, a hymn of praise to our God. Many will see and fear the Lord and put their trust in him.
Blessed is the one who trusts in the Lord, who does not look to the proud, to those who turn aside to false gods.
May all who seek you rejoice and be glad in you; may those who long for your saving help always say, 'The Lord is great!'
But I am poor and needy; may the Lord think of me. You are my help and my deliverer; you are my God, do not delay.
As for me, I am poor and needy, but the Lord takes thought for me. You are my help and my deliverer; do not delay, O my God!
I will declare your name to my people; in the assembly I will praise you.
You who fear the Lord, praise him! All you descendants of Jacob, honor him! Revere him, all you descendants of Israel!
For he has not despised or scorned the suffering of the afflicted one; he has not hidden his face from him but has listened to his cry for help.
From you comes the theme of my praise in the great assembly; before those who fear you I will fulfill my vows.
The poor will eat and be satisfied; those who seek the Lord will praise him—may your hearts live forever!
All the ends of the earth will remember and turn to the Lord, and all the families of the nations will bow down before him.
For dominion belongs to the Lord and he rules over the nations.
They will come and declare his righteousness to a people yet unborn—for he has done it.
In you, our ancestors put their trust; they trusted and you delivered them.
I waited patiently for the Lord; he turned to me and heard my cry.
Blessed is the one who trusts in the Lord, who does not look to the proud, to those who turn aside to false gods.
May all who seek you rejoice and be glad in you; may those who long for your saving help always say, 'The Lord is great!'
Do not withhold your mercy from me, Lord; may your love and faithfulness always protect me.
You are my help and my deliverer; do not delay, O my God.
The Lord is my rock, my fortress and my deliverer; my God is my rock, in whom I take refuge.
Vindicate me, Lord, for I have led a blameless life; I have trusted in the Lord and have not faltered.
As for me, I said, 'Lord, be merciful to me; heal me, for I have sinned against you.  - Jesus
My enemies say of me in malice, 'When will he die and his name perish?'
I trust in your unfailing love; my heart rejoices in your salvation.
But you, Lord, be merciful to me and raise me up, that I may repay them.
By this I know that you are pleased with me, because my enemy does not triumph over me.
In my integrity you uphold me and set me in your presence forever.
Praise be to the Lord, the God of Israel, from everlasting to everlasting. Amen and Amen.
Through you we push back our enemies; through your name we trample our foes.
And call on me in the day of trouble; I will deliver you, and you will honor me.
Create in me a pure heart, O God, and renew a steadfast spirit within me.
You, God, are my fortress, my loving God.
I will sing of your strength, in the morning I will sing of your love; for you are my fortress, my refuge in times of trouble.
O my Strength, I watch for you; you, God, are my fortress, my loving God.
Deliver me from my enemies, O God; be my fortress against those who are attacking me.
Lord, you have been our dwelling place throughout all generations.
Before the mountains were born or you brought forth the whole world, from everlasting to everlasting you are God.
Teach us to number our days, that we may gain a heart of wisdom.
Satisfy us in the morning with your unfailing love, that we may sing for joy and be glad all our days.
May the favor of the Lord our God rest on us; establish the work of our hands for us—yes, establish the work of our hands.
Lord, you have been our refuge in all generations.
He who dwells in the shelter of the Most High will rest in the shadow of the Almighty.
I will say of the Lord, 'He is my refuge and my fortress, my God, in whom I trust.'
He will cover you with his feathers, and under his wings you will find refuge; his faithfulness will be your shield and rampart.
You will not fear the terror of night, nor the arrow that flies by day,
Because he loves me,' says the Lord, 'I will rescue him; I will protect him, for he acknowledges my name.'
He will call on me, and I will answer him; I will be with him in trouble, I will deliver him and honor him.
With long life I will satisfy him and show him my salvation.
Lord, you have been our dwelling place throughout all generations.
Before the mountains were born or you brought forth the whole world, from everlasting to everlasting you are God.
You turn people back to dust, saying, 'Return to dust, you mortals.'
A thousand years in your sight are like a day that has just gone by, or like a watch in the night.
If only we knew the power of your anger! Your wrath is as great as the fear that is your due.
Teach us to number our days, that we may gain a heart of wisdom.
Relent, Lord! How long will it be? Have compassion on your servants.
Satisfy us in the morning with your unfailing love, that we may sing for joy and be glad all our days.
Make us glad for as many days as you have afflicted us, for as many years as we have seen trouble.
May your deeds be shown to your servants, your splendor to their children.
May the favor of the Lord our God rest on us; establish the work of our hands for us—yes, establish the work of our hands.
He who dwells in the shelter of the Most High will rest in the shadow of the Almighty.
I will say of the Lord, 'He is my refuge and my fortress, my God, in whom I trust.'
Surely he will save you from the fowler's snare and from the deadly pestilence.
He will cover you with his feathers, and under his wings you will find refuge; his faithfulness will be your shield and rampart.
You will not fear the terror of night, nor the arrow that flies by day,
Nor the pestilence that stalks in the darkness, nor the plague that destroys at midday.
A thousand may fall at your side, ten thousand at your right hand, but it will not come near you.
You will only observe with your eyes and see the punishment of the wicked.
If you say, 'The Lord is my refuge,' and you make the Most High your dwelling,
No harm will overtake you, no disaster will come near your tent.
For he will command his angels concerning you to guard you in all your ways;
They will lift you up in their hands, so that you will not strike your foot against a stone.
You will tread on the lion and the cobra; you will trample the great lion and the serpent.
It is good to praise the Lord and make music to your name, O Most High,
Proclaiming your love in the morning and your faithfulness at night,
For you make me glad by your deeds, Lord; I sing for joy at what your hands have done.
How great are your works, Lord, how profound your thoughts!
Senseless people do not know, fools do not understand,
That though the wicked spring up like grass and all evildoers flourish, they will be destroyed forever.
But you, Lord, are forever exalted.
For surely your enemies, Lord, surely your enemies will perish; all evildoers will be scattered.
My eyes have seen the defeat of my enemies; my ears have heard the defeat of my wicked foes.
The righteous will flourish like a palm tree
Planted in the house of the Lord, they will flourish in the courts of our God.
They will still bear fruit in old age, they will stay fresh and green
The Lord is upright; he is my Rock, and there is no wickedness in him.
The Lord reigns, he is robed in majesty; the Lord is robed in majesty and armed with strength; indeed, the world is established, firm and secure.
Your throne was established long ago; you are from all eternity.
Mightier than the thunder of the great waters, mightier than the breakers of the sea—the Lord on high is mighty.
Your statutes, Lord, stand firm; holiness adorns your house for endless days.
Come, let us sing for joy to the Lord; let us shout aloud to the Rock of our salvation.
Let us come before him with thanksgiving and exalt him with music and song.
For the Lord is the great God, the great King above all gods.
In his hand are the depths of the earth, and the mountain peaks belong to him.
The sea is his, for he made it, and his hands formed the dry land.
Come, let us bow down in worship, let us kneel before the Lord our Maker;
For he is our God and we are the people of his pasture, the flock under his care.
With God we will gain the victory, and he will trample down our enemies.
I will sing of the Lord’s great love forever; with my mouth I will make your faithfulness known through all generations.
I will declare that your love stands firm forever, that you have established your faithfulness in heaven itself.
For who in the skies above can compare with the Lord? Who is like the Lord among the heavenly beings?
In the council of the holy ones God is greatly feared; he is more awesome than all who surround him.
Righteousness and justice are the foundation of your throne; love and faithfulness go before you.
Blessed are those who have learned to acclaim you, who walk in the light of your presence, Lord.
They rejoice in your name all day long; they celebrate your righteousness.
I will crush his foes before him and strike down his adversaries.
For great is the Lord and most worthy of praise; he is to be feared above all gods.
Fire goes before him and consumes his foes on every side.
His lightning lights up the world; the earth sees and trembles.
Exalt the Lord our God and worship at his footstool; he is holy.
The Lord is my shepherd, I lack nothing.
He makes me lie down in green pastures.
He leads me beside quiet waters.
He refreshes my soul.
He guides me along the right paths for his name’s sake.
Even though I walk through the darkest valley, I will fear no evil, for you are with me.
Your rod and your staff, they comfort me.
You prepare a table before me in the presence of my enemies.
You anoint my head with oil; my cup overflows.
Surely goodness and mercy shall follow me all the days of my life.
And I will dwell in the house of the Lord forever.
Now then, my children, listen to me; blessed are those who keep my ways.
Listen to my instruction and be wise; do not disregard it.
Blessed is the one who listens to me, watching daily at my doors, waiting at my doorway.
She is a tree of life to those who take hold of her; those who hold her fast will be blessed.
My son, do not let wisdom and understanding out of your sight, preserve sound judgment and discretion;
For they will be life for you, an ornament to grace your neck.
Do not withhold good from those to whom it is due, when it is in your power to act.
Do not envy the violent or choose any of their ways.
For the Lord gives wisdom; from his mouth come knowledge and understanding.
Discretion will protect you, and understanding will guard you.
Trust in the Lord with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding;
In all your ways submit to him, and he will make your paths straight.
Do not be wise in your own eyes; fear the Lord and shun evil.
Honor the Lord with your wealth, with the firstfruits of all your crops;
Blessed are those who find wisdom, those who gain understanding,
For the waywardness of the simple will kill them, and the complacency of fools will destroy them;
The fear of the Lord is the beginning of knowledge, but fools despise wisdom and instruction.
My son, if sinful men entice you, do not give in to them.
For through wisdom your days will be many, and years will be added to your life.
Whoever corrects a mocker invites insults; whoever rebukes the wicked incurs abuse.
A gentle answer turns away wrath, but a harsh word stirs up anger.
The tongue of the wise adorns knowledge, but the mouth of the fool gushes folly.
The eyes of the Lord are everywhere, keeping watch on the wicked and the good.
The soothing tongue is a tree of life, but a perverse tongue crushes the spirit.
A hot-tempered person stirs up conflict, but the one who is patient calms a quarrel.
Pride goes before destruction, a haughty spirit before a fall.
Better a little with righteousness than much gain with injustice.
Commit to the Lord whatever you do, and he will establish your plans.
The Lord detests all the proud of heart. Be sure of this: They will not go unpunished.
Through love and faithfulness sin is atoned for; through the fear of the Lord evil is avoided.
When the Lord takes pleasure in anyone’s way, he causes their enemies to make peace with them.
In their hearts humans plan their course, but the Lord establishes their steps.
The highway of the upright avoids evil; those who guard their ways preserve their lives.
Gracious words are a honeycomb, sweet to the soul and healing to the bones.
Gray hair is a crown of splendor; it is attained in the way of righteousness.
Patience is better than power, and controlling one’s emotions, than capturing a city.
Do not speak to fools, for they will scorn your prudent words.
Let your eyes look straight ahead; fix your gaze directly before you.
Give careful thought to the paths for your feet and be steadfast in all your ways.
Do not turn to the right or the left; keep your foot from evil.
Listen, my son, accept what I say, and the years of your life will be many.
Gold there is, and rubies in abundance, but lips that speak knowledge are a rare jewel.
Pay attention and turn your ear to the sayings of the wise; apply your heart to what I teach.
Do not let your heart envy sinners, but always be zealous for the fear of the Lord.
Apply your heart to instruction and your ears to words of knowledge.
A friend loves at all times, and a brother is born for a time of adversity.
Even fools are thought wise if they keep silent, and discerning if they hold their tongues.
A cheerful heart is good medicine, but a crushed spirit dries up the bones.
Starting a fight is like breaking open a dam; so stop the argument before it turns into a big problem.
A happy heart makes you feel good, but feeling down can drain your energy.
Having a child who makes bad choices can make a parent feel really sad.
God tests our hearts just like gold is tested by fire.
It's better to have a simple meal in peace than a feast with lots of arguing.
Wise people choose their words carefully, and those with understanding stay calm.
It's wrong to say someone is guilty when they're not, or innocent when they're guilty.
Wise people think about what they do.
It's better to be alone and calm than in a house with someone who always argues.
Seeking good things and loving others brings happiness, success, and respect.
Smart people save up, but foolish people spend everything right away.
Being careful with your words can keep you out of trouble.
Planning carefully and working hard lead to profit, but rushing leads to loss.
Choosing the right path keeps you safe and happy.
Pay attention to learning and listen to wise advice.
Correcting a child when they do something wrong helps them learn.
Always seek truth and wisdom, and don't trade them for anything.
Don't be jealous of people who do bad things.
People who do wrong only cause trouble.
Using wisdom and understanding helps build a strong life, just like building a strong house.
Knowledge fills your life with valuable and beautiful things.
Being wise and knowledgeable gives you the power to do great things.
With good advice, you can accomplish big goals, and with many advisors, you can win.
A well-timed word is like golden apples in a silver basket.
Being patient can even convince leaders, and a gentle way of speaking can be very powerful.
Trusting someone who lets you down in tough times is like having a bad tooth or a wobbly foot.
Talking big but not giving is like clouds and wind without any rain.
A person who loves to argue is as annoying as constant dripping on a rainy day.
Smooth words may hide a mean heart, just like a pretty coating can cover a clay pot.
If you dig a hole for someone else, you might fall into it yourself. If you roll a stone, it might roll back on you.
Without self-control, a person is as defenseless as a city with broken-down walls.
Don't brag about tomorrow, since you don't know what the day will bring.
Let others praise you for your achievements, not your own mouth.
Jealousy is harder to face than anger and more hurtful than physical strength.
Honest criticism from a friend is better than being lied to by an enemy.
Someone who's full might even refuse dessert, but everything tastes great when you're hungry.
A person who wanders from home is like a bird that strays from its nest.
Friendship and good advice are refreshing and sweet, like perfume and incense that make the heart happy.
Don’t forget your friends or your family’s friends, and don’t always go to your family when you’re in trouble—nearby friends are better when you need help quickly.
It's great to find out you are forgiven; it's like getting a wonderful surprise.
Being too proud can ruin your day, just like drinking too much vinegar or getting caught in the rain.
If you help your enemy when they're hungry or thirsty, you might make a friend.
Lies can hurt as much as hitting someone with a stick.
Don't visit your neighbors too often, or they might get tired of you.
Just like honey, it's good to have something sweet, but don't have too much or you'll feel sick.
Good news from far away is like getting a letter that makes you very happy.
If you see your enemy thirsty or hungry, being nice to them by giving them food and water shows you're the bigger person.
Just as rain and snow refresh the earth, good news refreshes and cheers the soul.
Hiding your plans from someone sneaky protects you just like a safe hides treasures from a thief.
When you help those who are sad or having a hard time, your kindness can make their day better.
Stay away from fights. It's better to walk away than to get angry and say things you might regret.
Being honest and fair works out better than being sneaky and dishonest.
Listen to good advice and try hard to learn. It will make you smarter and your life better.
When you wake up and feel safe and happy, you know you've done something right.
Keep your promises, especially to those who are counting on you.
A kind word can change someone's entire day and even make them feel strong when they are weak.
A good friend's advice is sweet like honey, and listening to them can make you wiser.
Being gentle can stop a fight and a kind word can break down walls.
It's important to think before you speak, and to consider how your words will make others feel.
It is written, Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word that comes from the mouth of God.
You shall not tempt the Lord your God.
Go away Satan, It is written, You must worship the Lord your God and serve him only
Repent, live your life in a way that proves repentance, for the kingdom of heaven is near.
Come, follow me and I will make you fishers of men.
Whatever their sickness or disease, or if they were demon possessed or paralyzed, he healed them all.
Blessed are those who realize their need and dependence on God.
Blessed are those who mourn, for they will be comforted.
Blessed are the meek, they will inherit the earth.
Blessed are those who hunger and thirst for righteousness, they will be filled.
Blessed are the merciful, they will be shown mercy.
Blessed are the pure in heart, they will see God.
Blessed are the peacemakers, they will be called children of God.
I am the salt of the earth!
I am the light of the world.
If your right eye causes you to stumble, gouge it out and throw it away.
Give to the one who asks you, and do not run away from the one who wants to borrow from you.
Love your enemies and pray for those who persecute you
If you love those who love you, what reward will you get? Are not even the tax collectors doing that?
When you give to the needy, don't let your left hand know what your right hand is doing
Give in secret so your Father who sees what's done in secret will reward you.
When you pray, go into your room, close the door and pray to your Father, who is unseen. Your Father will reward you for what is done in secret.
Do not store up treasures on earth, where moths and rust destroy, and thieves break in and steal.
Store up for yourself treasures in heaven, where moths and verman can't destroy, and where thieves can't break in and steal.
The eye is the lamp of the body, so if your eye is spiritually perceptive, your whole body will be full of light.
If your spiritually blind, your whole body will be full of darkness, how great and terrible is that darkness!
No one can serve two masters, he will hate one and love the other, or devoted to one and despise the other.
You can't serve God and money, fame, status or anything more than the Lord.
Do not worry about your life, what you will eat or drink, or about your body, what you will wear. Is not life more than food, and body more than clothes?
Do not worry about tomorrow, tomorrow will worry about itself. Each day has enough trouble of its own.
Do not judge, or you too will be judged.
Why do you look at the speck of sawdust in your brother's eye and pay no attention to the plank in your own eye?
First take the plank out of your own eye, then you will see clearly to remove the speck from your brother's eye.
Do not throw your pearls to pigs. They may trample them under their feet, and turn and tear you to pieces.
Ask, and it will be given to you, seek and you will find, knock and the door will be opened.

Abraham believed God, and God counted him as righteous because of his faith.
Abraham never wavered in believing God's promise. He was fully convinced that God is able to do whatever he promises.
He was handed over to die because of our sins, and he was raised to life to make us right with God.
Since we have been made right in God's sight by faith, we have peace with God because of what Jesus Christ our Lord has done for us.
We can rejoice when we run into problems and trials, for we know that they help us develop endurance.
And endurance develops strength of character, and character strengthens our confident hope of salvation.
But God showed his great love for us by sending Christ to die for us while we sere still sinners.
So now we can rejoice in our wonderful new relationship with God because our Lord Jesus Christ has made us friends of God.
And since we have been made right in God's sight by the blood of Christ, he will certainly save us from God's condemnation.
For since our friendship with God was restored by the death of his Son while we were still his enemies, we will certainly be saved through the life of his Son.
But even greater is God's wonderful grace and his gift of righteousness, for all who receive it will live in triumph over sin and death through this one man, Jesus Christ.
For when we died with Christ we were set free from the power of sin.
Do not let sin control the way you live; do not give in to sinful desires.
Instead, give yourselves completely to God, for you were dead, but now you have new life.
